name: African Violet
description: Saintpaulia ionantha, commonly known as African Violet, is a small, compact, rosette-forming perennial native to eastern and southwestern Tanzania and southeastern Kenya in tropical East Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and features round to oval, velvety, dark green leaves (3-8 cm long) with slightly scalloped edges. The leaves are covered in fine hairs and grow in a rosette pattern. The plant produces clusters of five-petaled flowers in various colors including purple, blue, pink, white, and bicolored varieties. Flowers can be single, semi-double, or double and appear on stalks rising above the foliage. This plant displays an upright, bushy growth habit and typically matures to 10-20 cm in height and width. In its native habitat, it grows in shaded, humid areas of tropical forests, often on rocky outcroppings or in crevices. In terrariums or indoor settings, this plant adds natural beauty and continuous flowering to any environment. It's one of the most popular houseplants worldwide due to its long flowering period and relatively easy care.
